channel.title: media on IntangibleMatter
channel.description: Recent content in media on IntangibleMatter

item.title: It's the New Wave of the Future!
item.description: My music taste changes constantly. I had a long time where I mostly listened to video game music, then a good few months where I mostly listened to electro. (Thanks, Just Shapes and Beats!) Recently, though, I’ve been listening to hyperpop. For those of you who don’t know, hyperpop is a musical genre which can be loosely defined as a type of music that borrows strongly from pop for its layout, early 2000s internet for its musical aesthetics, and pretty much whatever the hell the artist feels like for the lyrics.

item.title: A Brief Hantiplad About Everything Everywhere All At Once
item.description: So I finally got to watch that movie everyone was talking about last year. It’s honestly even better than everyone says. The effects were amazing, the writing was fantastic, and the actors were all… *chef’s kiss*. Our deadpan-hyper chaotic-evil queen. My favourite character was easily Jobu Tupekai. She’s honestly everything I aspire to be. A cool, nihilistic, reality warping, amazing looking young adult who created an object that can destroy the most powerful people somewhat out of boredom.
